title: Drawing, "Design for a Wrought-Iron Balcony", ca. 1775
medium: Pen and black ink, graphite-ruled borders in pen and black ink on white laid paper
provenance: From the Collection of Léon Decloux
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Horizontal rectangle. Frontal elevation of a wrought-iron balcony supported on carved stone brackets. The central motif consists of a rosette within a studded circle, and vegetal arabesques at either side. At the ends, two vertical panels with similar motifs.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Wrought-Iron Balcony", ca. 1775.
ca. 1775. Pen and black ink, graphite-ruled borders in pen and black ink on white laid paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-156.
